description:
In 1937, before World War II begins in earnest. Lieutenant Colonel Yuuki of the Imperial Japanese Army forms the "D Agency," an army intelligence outfit under his command and tutelage. Army General Staff attaches Lieutenant Sakuma to observe the unit's performance. D Agency casts a wide net to find agents beyond Japanese military personnel, and Yuuki establishes D Agency's tenets, which go against IJA doctrine: "Don't kill, don't get killed, don't get captured." With this, Yuuki trains a team of operatives who conduct missions against domestic and foreign powers.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Maids

tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

title.native: ジョーカー・ゲーム 「黒猫ヨルの冒険」
Dの魔王　ジョーカー・ゲーム

node.description:
[Official Website](http://mmm-gee.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zi38)

Shirow Miwa is a Japanese manga artist and illustrator. He is best known as the writer and artist for the Dogs manga series, but has also contributed illustrations to various tribute books, and magazines, including Square Enix's Monthly Shounen Gangan. Miwa sometimes publishes under the circle name of m.m.m. + Gee. He is also an official member of Doujin Band Supercell as Illustrator and Designer. Miwa also drew the character designs for the games 7th Dragon 2020, 7th Dragon 2020-II and 7th Dragon III code:VFD which are sequel games (in that order) within the 7th Dragon series.

**Birthplace:** Mie Prefecture, Japan

Kouji Yanagi is a mystery/thriller novelist, best known for Joker Game.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/200070/)._
Retired as an animator in the early '00s.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/194614/)._
